page.title: 01Achreamie's farms & rivers
page.content: The block touches the sea at its NW corner and undulates its way to its southern edge where it starts to climb towards the hills in the next block. It is cut from east to west by the main north coast road and it is dominated in the NE corner by the river Forss, one of the most important salmon rivers in the area and the Forss House estate containing two disused mills and the post office for the area. The land is utilised for silage and pasture except in the central to western squares where it is enclosed but uncultivated and used for rough grazing, mostly sheep. In the intensively cultivated land the grazing is dairy and sheep and almost all of the dwellings in the area are farms, most of the exceptions being long since abandoned and derelict shells, built in local quarried stone.
